definition: facts of an injustice/circumstances surrounding a miscarriage of justice

sentences.english: The grievances were aired in Parliament last week.
sentences.chinese: 冤情上星期在议会陈述了。

sentences.english: She brayed out her grievances before the judge.
sentences.chinese: 她在法官面前“大声”诉说冤情。

sentences.english: Local leaders have been ordered to see that grievances are addressed and protests quickly contained.
sentences.chinese: 地方领导都被要求解决冤情并迅速平息抗议。

sentences.english: They represented their grievances to the Governor.
For Mr. Roosevelt believed that the men inside had a right a redress of their grievances.
sentences.chinese: 因为罗斯福先生相信里面的人又权昭雪他们的冤情。

sentences.english: It is the experience of almost every Indian who has had anything to do with such cases.
sentences.chinese: 几乎每一个与这些案件有干连的印度人都有冤情。

definition: to appeal for justice/to demand redress for a grievance
to exonerate/to clear (from an accusation)/to rehabilitate
to right wrongs/to redress an injustice
to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
lit. to wash out a grievance/fig. to right a wrong/to redress an injustice
unjust charge or verdict/miscarriage of justice/frame-up
to reverse a verdict/to present different views on a historical person or verdict
to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
